STYLE.NAME: French Cider
STYLE.NOTES: Medium to sweet cider, full bodied and rich. Includes Normandy styles. Entrants MUST specify carbonation level (petillant or sparking) and sweetness (medium, sweet)
STYLE.PROFILE: Medium to full body. Fruity character/aroma. May use arrested fermentation or juice to enhance sweetness. Medium to deep gold color. Clear to brilliant. Moderate to high carbonation.
STYLE.INGREDIENTS: Apples with some sugar adjuncts. High gravity wine, champagne or ale yeast. Often distinguished by apple variety (Nehou, Muscadet de Dieppe, Reine des Pommes, Michelin, etc).
STYLE.EXAMPLES: West County (various), Rhyne Cider, Eric Bordelet, Etienne Dupont
